        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I was reading the source code of download_target_determiner.cc (<span class="line"><!---->I was reading the source code of download_target_determiner.cc (<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> and found out there is a bug in the ReplaceExtension function (<span class="line"><!----> and found out there is a bug in the ReplaceExtension function (<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> which allows an attacker to perform the attack described in <span class="line"><!----> which allows an attacker to perform the attack described in <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>again.<span class="line"><!---->again.<!----></span><br><br>When a download happens, you can listen for the chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename and suggest a new name for the file.<span class="line"><!---->When a download happens, you can listen for the chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename and suggest a new name for the file.<!----></span><br>There is a check on <span class="line"><!---->There is a check on <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409<!----></a> that prevents changing the extension of local files that are downloaded.<span class="line"><!----> that prevents changing the extension of local files that are downloaded.<!----></span><br><br>The above check was added to fix <span class="line"><!---->The above check was added to fix <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>But digging deeper, I realized there is an edge case that isn't being tracked in the ReplaceExtension function (which is being used to prevent the change of the extension of local files that are downloaded).<span class="line"><!---->But digging deeper, I realized there is an edge case that isn't being tracked in the ReplaceExtension function (which is being used to prevent the change of the extension of local files that are downloaded).<!----></span><br><br>If file:///file.txt (local file) is downloaded, and you want to download it again and change its extension to file.html, the following happens:<span class="line"><!---->If file:///file.txt (local file) is downloaded, and you want to download it again and change its extension to file.html, the following happens:<!----></span><br><br>if (download_->GetURL().SchemeIsFile()) {<span class="line"><!---->if (download_-&gt;GetURL().SchemeIsFile()) {<!----></span><br>	base::FilePath file_path;<span class="line"><!---->	base::FilePath file_path;<!----></span><br>	net::FileURLToFilePath(download_->GetURL(), &file_path);<span class="line"><!---->	net::FileURLToFilePath(download_-&gt;GetURL(), &amp;file_path);<!----></span><br>	new_path = new_path.ReplaceExtension(file_path.Extension());<span class="line"><!---->	new_path = new_path.ReplaceExtension(file_path.Extension());<!----></span><br>} <span class="line"><!---->} <!----></span><br><br>New_path is the name you want to rename the file to, and file_path is the name of the original file.<span class="line"><!---->New_path is the name you want to rename the file to, and file_path is the name of the original file.<!----></span><br><br>file_path = file.txt<span class="line"><!---->file_path = file.txt<!----></span><br>new_path  = file.html<span class="line"><!---->new_path  = file.html<!----></span><br><br>By using the values above, the code works as expected:<span class="line"><!---->By using the values above, the code works as expected:<!----></span><br>new_path = "file.txt".ReplaceExtension(".html")<span class="line"><!---->new_path = "file.txt".ReplaceExtension(".html")<!----></span><br><br>As it would return "file.html", preventing an attacker to set a new extension to the local file.<span class="line"><!---->As it would return "file.html", preventing an attacker to set a new extension to the local file.<!----></span><br>But on the edge case where the original file has no extension and the new file has, the following happens:<span class="line"><!---->But on the edge case where the original file has no extension and the new file has, the following happens:<!----></span><br><br>file_path = History<span class="line"><!---->file_path = History<!----></span><br>new_path  = History.html.html<span class="line"><!---->new_path  = History.html.html<!----></span><br><br>new_path = "History.html.html".ReplaceExtension("")<span class="line"><!---->new_path = "History.html.html".ReplaceExtension("")<!----></span><br><br>Inside the ReplaceExtension function, we can see that if the new extension is empty, the current extension is removed:<span class="line"><!---->Inside the ReplaceExtension function, we can see that if the new extension is empty, the current extension is removed:<!----></span><br><br>FilePath no_ext = RemoveExtension();<span class="line"><!---->FilePath no_ext = RemoveExtension();<!----></span><br>// If the new extension is "" or ".", then just remove the current extension.<span class="line"><!---->// If the new extension is "" or ".", then just remove the current extension.<!----></span><br>if (extension.empty() ||<span class="line"><!---->if (extension.empty() ||<!----></span><br>  (extension.size() == 1 && extension[0] == kExtensionSeparator))<span class="line"><!---->  (extension.size() == 1 &amp;&amp; extension[0] == kExtensionSeparator))<!----></span><br>return no_ext;<span class="line"><!---->return no_ext;<!----></span><br><br>Which results in new_path being changed to "History.html" (as only the first ".html" is stripped).<span class="line"><!---->Which results in new_path being changed to "History.html" (as only the first ".html" is stripped).<!----></span><br><br>This makes it possible to exploit <span class="line"><!---->This makes it possible to exploit <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>again, by using "chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename" to listen for downloads and then rename files by using the bug described above. <span class="line"><!---->again, by using "chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename" to listen for downloads and then rename files by using the bug described above. <!----></span><br><br>The behavior described above can be combined with the ability to trigger the download of a local resource by redirecting a local file to a different local file that Chrome is not able to display (e.g. binaries). This forces the file to be downloaded, which in turn ends up firing the "DeterminingFilename" event.<span class="line"><!---->The behavior described above can be combined with the ability to trigger the download of a local resource by redirecting a local file to a different local file that Chrome is not able to display (e.g. binaries). This forces the file to be downloaded, which in turn ends up firing the "DeterminingFilename" event.<!----></span><br><br>Having all that in mind, the attack to read local files looks like this:<span class="line"><!---->Having all that in mind, the attack to read local files looks like this:<!----></span><br>1. User installs an extension that only asks for the "downloads" permission.<span class="line"><!---->1. User installs an extension that only asks for the "downloads" permission.<!----></span><br>2. Using "chrome.downloads.download" an HTML containing the payload is downloaded.<span class="line"><!---->2. Using "chrome.downloads.download" an HTML containing the payload is downloaded.<!----></span><br>3. Using the "chrome.downloads.onChanged" listener to retrieve the full path of the local file.<span class="line"><!---->3. Using the "chrome.downloads.onChanged" listener to retrieve the full path of the local file.<!----></span><br>4. Using "chrome.tabs.create", we open the HTML file we just downloaded locally.<span class="line"><!---->4. Using "chrome.tabs.create", we open the HTML file we just downloaded locally.<!----></span><br>5. We redirect the local page ten times to make sure that the title of the page is written to the local History file. The title of the page contains a script tag that has our payload.<span class="line"><!---->5. We redirect the local page ten times to make sure that the title of the page is written to the local History file. The title of the page contains a script tag that has our payload.<!----></span><br>6. After the redirects are finished, the page is navigated to file:///home/user/.config/google-chrome/Default/History. Given Chrome is not able to display this page, it ends up being downloaded.<span class="line"><!---->6. After the redirects are finished, the page is navigated to file:///home/user/.config/google-chrome/Default/History. Given Chrome is not able to display this page, it ends up being downloaded.<!----></span><br>7. The "DeterminingFilename" event will fire, allowing the attacker to rename the file from "History" to "attack.html" using the bug described in this report.<span class="line"><!---->7. The "DeterminingFilename" event will fire, allowing the attacker to rename the file from "History" to "attack.html" using the bug described in this report.<!----></span><br>8. The attacker's local HTML file is redirected to "attack.html" and the javascript code that was inserted earlier in the History file will trigger, allowing an attacker to leak the information.<span class="line"><!---->8. The attacker's local HTML file is redirected to "attack.html" and the javascript code that was inserted earlier in the History file will trigger, allowing an attacker to leak the information.<!----></span><br><br>I would like to highlight that the impact of this bug is in allowing an attacker to leak local files (more notably the user's cookies and history files) by using an extension that only had the "downloads" permission.<span class="line"><!---->I would like to highlight that the impact of this bug is in allowing an attacker to leak local files (more notably the user's cookies and history files) by using an extension that only had the "downloads" permission.<!----></span><br><br>The attack can be launched silently, but the PoC isn't doing that to make what is happening clear.<span class="line"><!---->The attack can be launched silently, but the PoC isn't doing that to make what is happening clear.<!----></span><br><br>For reference, last year there was <span class="line"><!---->For reference, last year there was <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>which was similar to this issue and allowed an attacker to read local files, and <span class="line"><!---->which was similar to this issue and allowed an attacker to read local files, and <!----></span>bug 1310461<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1310461" title="Security: chrome.downloads.download could be abused to steal user's environment variables like secrets, tokens or keys on windows."><!---->bug 1310461<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>which allowed an extension to leak environment variables. Both only required the "downloads" permission and I would argue have a similar impact to this issue.<span class="line"><!---->which allowed an extension to leak environment variables. Both only required the "downloads" permission and I would argue have a similar impact to this issue.<!----></span><br><br>I have also attached a video (repro.mkv) reproducing this bug.<span class="line"><!---->I have also attached a video (repro.mkv) reproducing this bug.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 105.0.5195.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 105.0.5195.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download "index.html" and serve the file on <span class="line"><!---->1. Download "index.html" and serve the file on <!----></span>http://localhost/index.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/index.html"><!---->http://localhost/index.html<!----></a><br>2. Download "extension.zip" and load it into Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->2. Download "extension.zip" and load it into Chrome.<!----></span><br>3. After a few seconds an alert will show up stating it was executed inside a copy of the History file, allowing the attacker to leak the information.<span class="line"><!---->3. After a few seconds an alert will show up stating it was executed inside a copy of the History file, allowing the attacker to leak the information.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. I think maybe the best option is to prevent local files from being renamed.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I think maybe the best option is to prevent local files from being renamed.<!----></span><br>Or otherwise we have to recursively remove all extensions from file names if the local file doesn't have an extension. But recursively removing extension seems wierd in many cases.<span class="line"><!---->Or otherwise we have to recursively remove all extensions from file names if the local file doesn't have an extension. But recursively removing extension seems wierd in many cases.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

          Add attachments
        <h3 class="medium-heading">

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;

          padding: 0;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I was reading the source code of download_target_determiner.cc (<span class="line"><!---->I was reading the source code of download_target_determiner.cc (<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> and found out there is a bug in the ReplaceExtension function (<span class="line"><!----> and found out there is a bug in the ReplaceExtension function (<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> which allows an attacker to perform the attack described in <span class="line"><!----> which allows an attacker to perform the attack described in <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>again.<span class="line"><!---->again.<!----></span><br><br>When a download happens, you can listen for the chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename and suggest a new name for the file.<span class="line"><!---->When a download happens, you can listen for the chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename and suggest a new name for the file.<!----></span><br>There is a check on <span class="line"><!---->There is a check on <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409<!----></a> that prevents changing the extension of local files that are downloaded.<span class="line"><!----> that prevents changing the extension of local files that are downloaded.<!----></span><br><br>The above check was added to fix <span class="line"><!---->The above check was added to fix <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>But digging deeper, I realized there is an edge case that isn't being tracked in the ReplaceExtension function (which is being used to prevent the change of the extension of local files that are downloaded).<span class="line"><!---->But digging deeper, I realized there is an edge case that isn't being tracked in the ReplaceExtension function (which is being used to prevent the change of the extension of local files that are downloaded).<!----></span><br><br>If file:///file.txt (local file) is downloaded, and you want to download it again and change its extension to file.html, the following happens:<span class="line"><!---->If file:///file.txt (local file) is downloaded, and you want to download it again and change its extension to file.html, the following happens:<!----></span><br><br>if (download_->GetURL().SchemeIsFile()) {<span class="line"><!---->if (download_-&gt;GetURL().SchemeIsFile()) {<!----></span><br>	base::FilePath file_path;<span class="line"><!---->	base::FilePath file_path;<!----></span><br>	net::FileURLToFilePath(download_->GetURL(), &file_path);<span class="line"><!---->	net::FileURLToFilePath(download_-&gt;GetURL(), &amp;file_path);<!----></span><br>	new_path = new_path.ReplaceExtension(file_path.Extension());<span class="line"><!---->	new_path = new_path.ReplaceExtension(file_path.Extension());<!----></span><br>} <span class="line"><!---->} <!----></span><br><br>New_path is the name you want to rename the file to, and file_path is the name of the original file.<span class="line"><!---->New_path is the name you want to rename the file to, and file_path is the name of the original file.<!----></span><br><br>file_path = file.txt<span class="line"><!---->file_path = file.txt<!----></span><br>new_path  = file.html<span class="line"><!---->new_path  = file.html<!----></span><br><br>By using the values above, the code works as expected:<span class="line"><!---->By using the values above, the code works as expected:<!----></span><br>new_path = "file.txt".ReplaceExtension(".html")<span class="line"><!---->new_path = "file.txt".ReplaceExtension(".html")<!----></span><br><br>As it would return "file.html", preventing an attacker to set a new extension to the local file.<span class="line"><!---->As it would return "file.html", preventing an attacker to set a new extension to the local file.<!----></span><br>But on the edge case where the original file has no extension and the new file has, the following happens:<span class="line"><!---->But on the edge case where the original file has no extension and the new file has, the following happens:<!----></span><br><br>file_path = History<span class="line"><!---->file_path = History<!----></span><br>new_path  = History.html.html<span class="line"><!---->new_path  = History.html.html<!----></span><br><br>new_path = "History.html.html".ReplaceExtension("")<span class="line"><!---->new_path = "History.html.html".ReplaceExtension("")<!----></span><br><br>Inside the ReplaceExtension function, we can see that if the new extension is empty, the current extension is removed:<span class="line"><!---->Inside the ReplaceExtension function, we can see that if the new extension is empty, the current extension is removed:<!----></span><br><br>FilePath no_ext = RemoveExtension();<span class="line"><!---->FilePath no_ext = RemoveExtension();<!----></span><br>// If the new extension is "" or ".", then just remove the current extension.<span class="line"><!---->// If the new extension is "" or ".", then just remove the current extension.<!----></span><br>if (extension.empty() ||<span class="line"><!---->if (extension.empty() ||<!----></span><br>  (extension.size() == 1 && extension[0] == kExtensionSeparator))<span class="line"><!---->  (extension.size() == 1 &amp;&amp; extension[0] == kExtensionSeparator))<!----></span><br>return no_ext;<span class="line"><!---->return no_ext;<!----></span><br><br>Which results in new_path being changed to "History.html" (as only the first ".html" is stripped).<span class="line"><!---->Which results in new_path being changed to "History.html" (as only the first ".html" is stripped).<!----></span><br><br>This makes it possible to exploit <span class="line"><!---->This makes it possible to exploit <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>again, by using "chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename" to listen for downloads and then rename files by using the bug described above. <span class="line"><!---->again, by using "chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename" to listen for downloads and then rename files by using the bug described above. <!----></span><br><br>The behavior described above can be combined with the ability to trigger the download of a local resource by redirecting a local file to a different local file that Chrome is not able to display (e.g. binaries). This forces the file to be downloaded, which in turn ends up firing the "DeterminingFilename" event.<span class="line"><!---->The behavior described above can be combined with the ability to trigger the download of a local resource by redirecting a local file to a different local file that Chrome is not able to display (e.g. binaries). This forces the file to be downloaded, which in turn ends up firing the "DeterminingFilename" event.<!----></span><br><br>Having all that in mind, the attack to read local files looks like this:<span class="line"><!---->Having all that in mind, the attack to read local files looks like this:<!----></span><br>1. User installs an extension that only asks for the "downloads" permission.<span class="line"><!---->1. User installs an extension that only asks for the "downloads" permission.<!----></span><br>2. Using "chrome.downloads.download" an HTML containing the payload is downloaded.<span class="line"><!---->2. Using "chrome.downloads.download" an HTML containing the payload is downloaded.<!----></span><br>3. Using the "chrome.downloads.onChanged" listener to retrieve the full path of the local file.<span class="line"><!---->3. Using the "chrome.downloads.onChanged" listener to retrieve the full path of the local file.<!----></span><br>4. Using "chrome.tabs.create", we open the HTML file we just downloaded locally.<span class="line"><!---->4. Using "chrome.tabs.create", we open the HTML file we just downloaded locally.<!----></span><br>5. We redirect the local page ten times to make sure that the title of the page is written to the local History file. The title of the page contains a script tag that has our payload.<span class="line"><!---->5. We redirect the local page ten times to make sure that the title of the page is written to the local History file. The title of the page contains a script tag that has our payload.<!----></span><br>6. After the redirects are finished, the page is navigated to file:///home/user/.config/google-chrome/Default/History. Given Chrome is not able to display this page, it ends up being downloaded.<span class="line"><!---->6. After the redirects are finished, the page is navigated to file:///home/user/.config/google-chrome/Default/History. Given Chrome is not able to display this page, it ends up being downloaded.<!----></span><br>7. The "DeterminingFilename" event will fire, allowing the attacker to rename the file from "History" to "attack.html" using the bug described in this report.<span class="line"><!---->7. The "DeterminingFilename" event will fire, allowing the attacker to rename the file from "History" to "attack.html" using the bug described in this report.<!----></span><br>8. The attacker's local HTML file is redirected to "attack.html" and the javascript code that was inserted earlier in the History file will trigger, allowing an attacker to leak the information.<span class="line"><!---->8. The attacker's local HTML file is redirected to "attack.html" and the javascript code that was inserted earlier in the History file will trigger, allowing an attacker to leak the information.<!----></span><br><br>I would like to highlight that the impact of this bug is in allowing an attacker to leak local files (more notably the user's cookies and history files) by using an extension that only had the "downloads" permission.<span class="line"><!---->I would like to highlight that the impact of this bug is in allowing an attacker to leak local files (more notably the user's cookies and history files) by using an extension that only had the "downloads" permission.<!----></span><br><br>The attack can be launched silently, but the PoC isn't doing that to make what is happening clear.<span class="line"><!---->The attack can be launched silently, but the PoC isn't doing that to make what is happening clear.<!----></span><br><br>For reference, last year there was <span class="line"><!---->For reference, last year there was <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>which was similar to this issue and allowed an attacker to read local files, and <span class="line"><!---->which was similar to this issue and allowed an attacker to read local files, and <!----></span>bug 1310461<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1310461" title="Security: chrome.downloads.download could be abused to steal user's environment variables like secrets, tokens or keys on windows."><!---->bug 1310461<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>which allowed an extension to leak environment variables. Both only required the "downloads" permission and I would argue have a similar impact to this issue.<span class="line"><!---->which allowed an extension to leak environment variables. Both only required the "downloads" permission and I would argue have a similar impact to this issue.<!----></span><br><br>I have also attached a video (repro.mkv) reproducing this bug.<span class="line"><!---->I have also attached a video (repro.mkv) reproducing this bug.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 105.0.5195.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 105.0.5195.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download "index.html" and serve the file on <span class="line"><!---->1. Download "index.html" and serve the file on <!----></span>http://localhost/index.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/index.html"><!---->http://localhost/index.html<!----></a><br>2. Download "extension.zip" and load it into Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->2. Download "extension.zip" and load it into Chrome.<!----></span><br>3. After a few seconds an alert will show up stating it was executed inside a copy of the History file, allowing the attacker to leak the information.<span class="line"><!---->3. After a few seconds an alert will show up stating it was executed inside a copy of the History file, allowing the attacker to leak the information.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. I think maybe the best option is to prevent local files from being renamed.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I think maybe the best option is to prevent local files from being renamed.<!----></span><br>Or otherwise we have to recursively remove all extensions from file names if the local file doesn't have an extension. But recursively removing extension seems wierd in many cases.<span class="line"><!---->Or otherwise we have to recursively remove all extensions from file names if the local file doesn't have an extension. But recursively removing extension seems wierd in many cases.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

          Add attachments
        <h3 class="medium-heading">

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

            Issue 1377165: Reading local files through an extension that only has the "downloads" permission

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>I was reading the source code of download_target_determiner.cc (<span class="line"><!---->I was reading the source code of download_target_determiner.cc (<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> and found out there is a bug in the ReplaceExtension function (<span class="line"><!----> and found out there is a bug in the ReplaceExtension function (<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/files/file_path.cc;drc=b3842582ae4610f1847d69076ad00570c2eafd79;l=463<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> which allows an attacker to perform the attack described in <span class="line"><!----> which allows an attacker to perform the attack described in <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>again.<span class="line"><!---->again.<!----></span><br><br>When a download happens, you can listen for the chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename and suggest a new name for the file.<span class="line"><!---->When a download happens, you can listen for the chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename and suggest a new name for the file.<!----></span><br>There is a check on <span class="line"><!---->There is a check on <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/download/download_target_determiner.cc;l=409<!----></a> that prevents changing the extension of local files that are downloaded.<span class="line"><!----> that prevents changing the extension of local files that are downloaded.<!----></span><br><br>The above check was added to fix <span class="line"><!---->The above check was added to fix <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>But digging deeper, I realized there is an edge case that isn't being tracked in the ReplaceExtension function (which is being used to prevent the change of the extension of local files that are downloaded).<span class="line"><!---->But digging deeper, I realized there is an edge case that isn't being tracked in the ReplaceExtension function (which is being used to prevent the change of the extension of local files that are downloaded).<!----></span><br><br>If file:///file.txt (local file) is downloaded, and you want to download it again and change its extension to file.html, the following happens:<span class="line"><!---->If file:///file.txt (local file) is downloaded, and you want to download it again and change its extension to file.html, the following happens:<!----></span><br><br>if (download_->GetURL().SchemeIsFile()) {<span class="line"><!---->if (download_-&gt;GetURL().SchemeIsFile()) {<!----></span><br>	base::FilePath file_path;<span class="line"><!---->	base::FilePath file_path;<!----></span><br>	net::FileURLToFilePath(download_->GetURL(), &file_path);<span class="line"><!---->	net::FileURLToFilePath(download_-&gt;GetURL(), &amp;file_path);<!----></span><br>	new_path = new_path.ReplaceExtension(file_path.Extension());<span class="line"><!---->	new_path = new_path.ReplaceExtension(file_path.Extension());<!----></span><br>} <span class="line"><!---->} <!----></span><br><br>New_path is the name you want to rename the file to, and file_path is the name of the original file.<span class="line"><!---->New_path is the name you want to rename the file to, and file_path is the name of the original file.<!----></span><br><br>file_path = file.txt<span class="line"><!---->file_path = file.txt<!----></span><br>new_path  = file.html<span class="line"><!---->new_path  = file.html<!----></span><br><br>By using the values above, the code works as expected:<span class="line"><!---->By using the values above, the code works as expected:<!----></span><br>new_path = "file.txt".ReplaceExtension(".html")<span class="line"><!---->new_path = "file.txt".ReplaceExtension(".html")<!----></span><br><br>As it would return "file.html", preventing an attacker to set a new extension to the local file.<span class="line"><!---->As it would return "file.html", preventing an attacker to set a new extension to the local file.<!----></span><br>But on the edge case where the original file has no extension and the new file has, the following happens:<span class="line"><!---->But on the edge case where the original file has no extension and the new file has, the following happens:<!----></span><br><br>file_path = History<span class="line"><!---->file_path = History<!----></span><br>new_path  = History.html.html<span class="line"><!---->new_path  = History.html.html<!----></span><br><br>new_path = "History.html.html".ReplaceExtension("")<span class="line"><!---->new_path = "History.html.html".ReplaceExtension("")<!----></span><br><br>Inside the ReplaceExtension function, we can see that if the new extension is empty, the current extension is removed:<span class="line"><!---->Inside the ReplaceExtension function, we can see that if the new extension is empty, the current extension is removed:<!----></span><br><br>FilePath no_ext = RemoveExtension();<span class="line"><!---->FilePath no_ext = RemoveExtension();<!----></span><br>// If the new extension is "" or ".", then just remove the current extension.<span class="line"><!---->// If the new extension is "" or ".", then just remove the current extension.<!----></span><br>if (extension.empty() ||<span class="line"><!---->if (extension.empty() ||<!----></span><br>  (extension.size() == 1 && extension[0] == kExtensionSeparator))<span class="line"><!---->  (extension.size() == 1 &amp;&amp; extension[0] == kExtensionSeparator))<!----></span><br>return no_ext;<span class="line"><!---->return no_ext;<!----></span><br><br>Which results in new_path being changed to "History.html" (as only the first ".html" is stripped).<span class="line"><!---->Which results in new_path being changed to "History.html" (as only the first ".html" is stripped).<!----></span><br><br>This makes it possible to exploit <span class="line"><!---->This makes it possible to exploit <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>again, by using "chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename" to listen for downloads and then rename files by using the bug described above. <span class="line"><!---->again, by using "chrome.downloads.onDeterminingFilename" to listen for downloads and then rename files by using the bug described above. <!----></span><br><br>The behavior described above can be combined with the ability to trigger the download of a local resource by redirecting a local file to a different local file that Chrome is not able to display (e.g. binaries). This forces the file to be downloaded, which in turn ends up firing the "DeterminingFilename" event.<span class="line"><!---->The behavior described above can be combined with the ability to trigger the download of a local resource by redirecting a local file to a different local file that Chrome is not able to display (e.g. binaries). This forces the file to be downloaded, which in turn ends up firing the "DeterminingFilename" event.<!----></span><br><br>Having all that in mind, the attack to read local files looks like this:<span class="line"><!---->Having all that in mind, the attack to read local files looks like this:<!----></span><br>1. User installs an extension that only asks for the "downloads" permission.<span class="line"><!---->1. User installs an extension that only asks for the "downloads" permission.<!----></span><br>2. Using "chrome.downloads.download" an HTML containing the payload is downloaded.<span class="line"><!---->2. Using "chrome.downloads.download" an HTML containing the payload is downloaded.<!----></span><br>3. Using the "chrome.downloads.onChanged" listener to retrieve the full path of the local file.<span class="line"><!---->3. Using the "chrome.downloads.onChanged" listener to retrieve the full path of the local file.<!----></span><br>4. Using "chrome.tabs.create", we open the HTML file we just downloaded locally.<span class="line"><!---->4. Using "chrome.tabs.create", we open the HTML file we just downloaded locally.<!----></span><br>5. We redirect the local page ten times to make sure that the title of the page is written to the local History file. The title of the page contains a script tag that has our payload.<span class="line"><!---->5. We redirect the local page ten times to make sure that the title of the page is written to the local History file. The title of the page contains a script tag that has our payload.<!----></span><br>6. After the redirects are finished, the page is navigated to file:///home/user/.config/google-chrome/Default/History. Given Chrome is not able to display this page, it ends up being downloaded.<span class="line"><!---->6. After the redirects are finished, the page is navigated to file:///home/user/.config/google-chrome/Default/History. Given Chrome is not able to display this page, it ends up being downloaded.<!----></span><br>7. The "DeterminingFilename" event will fire, allowing the attacker to rename the file from "History" to "attack.html" using the bug described in this report.<span class="line"><!---->7. The "DeterminingFilename" event will fire, allowing the attacker to rename the file from "History" to "attack.html" using the bug described in this report.<!----></span><br>8. The attacker's local HTML file is redirected to "attack.html" and the javascript code that was inserted earlier in the History file will trigger, allowing an attacker to leak the information.<span class="line"><!---->8. The attacker's local HTML file is redirected to "attack.html" and the javascript code that was inserted earlier in the History file will trigger, allowing an attacker to leak the information.<!----></span><br><br>I would like to highlight that the impact of this bug is in allowing an attacker to leak local files (more notably the user's cookies and history files) by using an extension that only had the "downloads" permission.<span class="line"><!---->I would like to highlight that the impact of this bug is in allowing an attacker to leak local files (more notably the user's cookies and history files) by using an extension that only had the "downloads" permission.<!----></span><br><br>The attack can be launched silently, but the PoC isn't doing that to make what is happening clear.<span class="line"><!---->The attack can be launched silently, but the PoC isn't doing that to make what is happening clear.<!----></span><br><br>For reference, last year there was <span class="line"><!---->For reference, last year there was <!----></span>bug 1176031<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1176031" title="Reading local files through an extension that only has the &quot;downloads&quot; permission"><!---->bug 1176031<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>which was similar to this issue and allowed an attacker to read local files, and <span class="line"><!---->which was similar to this issue and allowed an attacker to read local files, and <!----></span>bug 1310461<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1310461" title="Security: chrome.downloads.download could be abused to steal user's environment variables like secrets, tokens or keys on windows."><!---->bug 1310461<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>which allowed an extension to leak environment variables. Both only required the "downloads" permission and I would argue have a similar impact to this issue.<span class="line"><!---->which allowed an extension to leak environment variables. Both only required the "downloads" permission and I would argue have a similar impact to this issue.<!----></span><br><br>I have also attached a video (repro.mkv) reproducing this bug.<span class="line"><!---->I have also attached a video (repro.mkv) reproducing this bug.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 105.0.5195.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 105.0.5195.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download "index.html" and serve the file on <span class="line"><!---->1. Download "index.html" and serve the file on <!----></span>http://localhost/index.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost/index.html"><!---->http://localhost/index.html<!----></a><br>2. Download "extension.zip" and load it into Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->2. Download "extension.zip" and load it into Chrome.<!----></span><br>3. After a few seconds an alert will show up stating it was executed inside a copy of the History file, allowing the attacker to leak the information.<span class="line"><!---->3. After a few seconds an alert will show up stating it was executed inside a copy of the History file, allowing the attacker to leak the information.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. I think maybe the best option is to prevent local files from being renamed.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I think maybe the best option is to prevent local files from being renamed.<!----></span><br>Or otherwise we have to recursively remove all extensions from file names if the local file doesn't have an extension. But recursively removing extension seems wierd in many cases.<span class="line"><!---->Or otherwise we have to recursively remove all extensions from file names if the local file doesn't have an extension. But recursively removing extension seems wierd in many cases.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
